title: Tame The Best
description: Online resources that reframe chronic pain by understanding it as more than just physical pain. It promotes retraining the nervous system through education, movement, and mindset shifts to reduce suffering.
creator: University of South Australia

title: Pain Revolution
description: A program that trains health professionals to teach communities about pain science. It empowers people to manage chronic pain through education, movement, and self-care strategies.
creator: University of South Australia

title: Pain Trainer
description: An interactive, online program that teaches effective research-backed strategies to manage pain.
creator: Melbourne School of Health Sciences

title: Pelvic Rehab
description: An online course that covers pain education, mind-body connection, and nervous system retraining, with exercises in brain mapping, NLP, self-hypnosis, mindfulness, and therapies like light and sound.
creator: Private clinics across the USA

title: Chronic Pain Centre, UCalgary
description: A collection of resources to educate and empower people with chronic pain to achieve mental and physical well-being.
creator: University of Calgary

title: Pain BC
description: A non-profit focusing on providing resources, education, and support to individuals suffering from pain, as well as to healthcare providers and communities
creator: Pain BC Society

title: Retrain Pain Foundation
description: A collection of resources to educate clinicians and organizations with innovative training programs to transform pain care.
creator: Private hospitals & orgs across the USA

title: Power Over Pain
description: Resources for chronic pain, including videos, articles, online workshops, support groups, 24/7 counseling, and research-based pain management courses, with wellness assessments and provincial resources.
creator: Hospital & research foundations across Canada

title: The IMPACT Program
description: Platform to access Power Over Pain through efficient video modules (45-60 mins) on Reclaiming Your Life with ACT (Acceptance and Commitment Therapy) and Mindfulness to manage chronic pain.
creator: Power Over Pain

title: Empowered Management Program
description: An online course that covers strategies for pain management through biopsychosocial and self-compassion approaches.
creator: Power Over Pain

title: TAPMI Pain
description: A collection of online modules on sleep, pain medications, stress, lifestyle, communication & pain flares
creator: Toronto Academic Pain Medicine Institute

title: The Vulvodynia Primary Care Toolkit
description: Resources for those affected by vulvodynia, providing educational materials, self-care tips, treatment options, and expert guidance to help manage and understand this chronic condition.
creator: BC Centre for Vulvar Health & Doctors of BC

title: Hello Vulva
description: An Instagram account focused on educating and empowering individuals on vulvar health, raising awareness, and breaking the stigma around vulvodynia and related conditions.
creator: BC Centre for Vulvar Health

title: Your Period
description: This site dives deep into endometriosis—what it is, why it happens, and how to manage it. Patients can explore detailed guides, treatment options, diagnosis methods, personal stories, live Q&As, and culturally sensitive resources tailored to diverse communities.
creator: Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC)

title: Sex & U
description: SexandU.ca's "Concerns & Sexual Problems" section addresses common sexual health issues like painful intercourse, erectile dysfunction, and low libido. It emphasizes open communication, encourages consulting healthcare professionals, and explores available treatment options to enhance sexual well-being.
creator: Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC)

title: Endometriosis Portal
description: GynQI.com provides a comprehensive guide to endometriosis, detailing symptoms like pelvic pain and infertility, diagnostic challenges, and various treatment options, including hormonal therapies and surgical interventions, to empower individuals in managing this chronic condition
creator: Gynaecology Quality Improvement Collaboration

title: Omgyes
description: OMGYES is an interactive platform offering research-based insights into women's sexual pleasure. Through candid videos, animations, and touchable simulations, it educates individuals and couples on diverse techniques to enhance intimacy and understanding.
creator: Omgyes

title: Prosayla
description: Prosayla offers a comprehensive collection of medically reviewed articles focusing on female sexual health. Topics include anorgasmia, menopause's impact on sexuality, pelvic floor dysfunction, and more, providing evidence-based information to support women's well-being. ​
creator: The International Society for the Study of Women’s Sexual Health (ISSWSH)

title: National Vulvodynia Association
description: The National Vulvodynia Association's Self-Help Tips section offers practical advice for managing vulvar pain. It covers clothing choices, hygiene practices, sexual activity adjustments, and physical activity modifications to alleviate discomfort and prevent further irritation. ​
creator: The National Vulvodynia Association

title: Long Term Pelvic Pain
description: The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists provides comprehensive information on chronic pelvic pain, including potential causes, diagnostic procedures, and treatment options, empowering individuals to make informed decisions about their health. ​
creator: RCOG Patient Information Committee

title: Hope Mental Health for Women
description: HopeMentalHealth4Women.com offers resources for women's emotional well-being, including articles on emotional strengths and attachment, and courses on interpersonal psychotherapy for relationships and grief, supporting women in their mental health journey.
creator: University of Calgary, Spark Calgary, CIHR, Royal Alexandra Hospital Foundation, AWHF, Lois Hole Hospital for Women, Women&Children's health research institute

title: Mindful Coping
description: MindfulCoping.com offers free, science-based, audio-guided lessons and exercises developed by psychologists to enhance stress resilience. Users can learn effective coping strategies for managing stress, emotions, and life's challenges through accessible, research-backed techniques.
creator: Yale University School of Medicine, John Hopkins University School of Medicine, University of New Mexico, New Mexico Veterans Affairs Healthcare System

title: Anxiety Canada
description: Anxiety Canada is a registered charity offering free, evidence-based resources to help individuals understand and manage anxiety. Their offerings include self-help articles, educational videos, and the MindShift CBT app, supporting mental well-being across various age groups
creator: Anxiety Canada

title: Center for Mindful Self-Compassion
description: The Center for Mindful Self-Compassion offers programs and resources to cultivate self-compassion, including online courses, workshops, and free guided meditations. Founded by Drs. Kristin Neff and Chris Germer, it aims to enhance emotional resilience and well-being.
creator: Dr. Kristin Neff and Dr. Chris Germer

title: Self-Compassion
description: Self-Compassion.org, created by Dr. Kristin Neff, offers resources to cultivate self-kindness, including guided meditations, exercises, and research articles. It aims to help individuals embrace their imperfections and enhance emotional resilience through self-compassion practices.
creator: Dr. Kristin Neff

title: Therapy in a Nutshell
description: The "Leaves on a Stream" video introduces a mindfulness exercise rooted in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT). It guides viewers to observe their thoughts as leaves floating by, promoting cognitive defusion and reducing overthinking
creator: Emma McAdam

title: My Pain Diary: Chronic Pain & Symptom Tracker
description: Allows you to track, manage, and report on your pain, symptoms, and triggers. An interactive graph and color-coded calendar help you identify patterns, trends, and correlations.

title: Pain Diary and Forum-CatchMyPain
description: Allows you to visualize and monitor your pain by creating detailed drawings and by tracking other relevant information. The diary will help you to explain your pain to any medical practitioner. In addition, you can exchange insights with others

title: Pain Scale
description: In addition to its tracking function, you can also check out the app’s community feature, to see how other people with similar conditions manage their pain. The app also includes a library of articles and videos from medical sources.

title: Calm
description: Calm is a popular mental wellness app offering guided meditations, breathing exercises, sleep stories, and relaxing music. It supports better sleep, stress reduction, and mindfulness through beautifully designed, user-friendly tools for daily emotional and mental health care.

title: Insight Timer
description: Insight Timer is a free meditation app offering over 230,000 guided meditations, music tracks, and talks from 17,000 teachers. It includes a customizable timer, mood tracking, and community groups, supporting mindfulness, stress reduction, and sleep improvement.

title: Curable
description: Curable is an app designed to help individuals manage chronic pain through a biopsychosocial approach. It offers personalized programs featuring guided meditations, cognitive behavioral therapy techniques, pain science education, and expressive writing exercises to address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain.

title: Headspace
description: Headspace is a comprehensive mental health app offering guided meditations, mindfulness exercises, sleep aids, and stress management tools. Designed for users of all experience levels, it aims to improve focus, reduce anxiety, and promote overall well-being.

title: Better Sex Through Mindfulness
description: "Better Sex Through Mindfulness" by Dr. Lori Brotto offers a groundbreaking approach to enhancing women's sexual desire and satisfaction using mindfulness techniques. The accompanying workbook provides practical exercises to cultivate desire and improve intimacy.
creator: Dr. Lori Brotto

title: The Mindful Self-Compassion Workbook
description: "The Mindful Self-Compassion Workbook" by Dr. Kristin Neff and Christopher Germer offers a structured, science-based program with practical exercises, meditations, and reflective practices to help readers cultivate self-compassion, enhance emotional resilience, and improve overall well-being.
creator: Dr. Kristin Neff and Christopher Germer

title: Living Untethered
description: "Living Untethered" by Michael A. Singer offers practical guidance on transcending habitual thoughts and emotions to achieve self-realization and unconditional happiness. It explores the origins of inner disturbances and provides strategies for releasing them to experience life's fullness
creator: Michael Singer

title: Freedom from Pain
description: "Freedom from Pain" by Drs. Peter A. Levine and Maggie Phillips presents a mind-body approach to chronic pain relief. It offers strategies to address unresolved emotional trauma, including mindfulness, controlled breathing, and affirmations, aiming to alleviate suffering and enhance well-being.
creator: Dr. Peter A. Levine and Maggie Phillips

title: Well-being
description: Well-being by Penny offers virtual pelvic floor yoga classes tailored for individuals with hypertonic pelvic floor dysfunction. Led by certified instructor Penny Petersson, the program focuses on movement, breathwork, and body awareness to alleviate tension and manage pelvic pain.
creator: Penny Petersson

title: Well Central
description: Well Central is a free, self-directed online platform offering interactive courses designed to enhance mental health and support recovery. Developed by the Canadian Mental Health Association, it empowers individuals to take control of their well-being through accessible education.
creator: Canadian Mental Health Association

title: Holden QiGong
description: Holden QiGong, founded by Lee Holden, offers online programs blending traditional Qi Gong practices with modern insights. It provides courses, live classes, and workshops aimed at enhancing physical health, mental clarity, and emotional balance through accessible mind-body exercises
creator: Lee Holden

title: Ride the Wave
description: "Ride the Wave" is a mindfulness-based coping strategy that encourages individuals to observe and accept their emotional experiences without resistance. By acknowledging feelings as they arise and allowing them to pass naturally, this technique fosters emotional resilience and reduces distress.
creator: PCMH Colorado

title: Vibrant Pelvic Health
description: Dr. Bri's Vibrant Pelvic Health offers online programs designed to address pelvic health issues such as pelvic pain and prolapse. These programs incorporate daily routines, mindset strategies, nutrition guidance, and relaxation techniques to support individuals on their healing journey
creator: Dr. Bri

title: PowerOverPain
description: PowerOverPain.ca is a Canadian portal offering free, evidence-based resources for chronic pain management. It provides articles, videos, self-directed courses, and peer support to empower individuals in their pain management journey.
creator: Hospital & research foundations across Canada

title: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) course
description: Palouse Mindfulness offers a free, self-guided 8-week Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) course, developed by certified instructor Dave Potter. Based on Jon Kabat-Zinn's program, it includes guided meditations, readings, and videos to help individuals manage stress and enhance well-being.
creator: Dave Potter

title: Come as You Are
description: "Come as You Are" by Dr. Emily Nagoski explores the latest scientific research on women's sexuality, offering insights into the complexities of desire and arousal. The book provides practical guidance for enhancing sexual well-being and confidence.
creator: Dr. Emily Nagoski

title: Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle
description: "Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle" by Emily and Amelia Nagoski examines how chronic stress uniquely affects women. It offers science-based strategies to complete the stress cycle, manage emotions, and lead a more balanced, joyful life.
creator: Dr. Emily and Amelia Nagoski
